title: An historical anatomy of Christian melancholy, sympathetically set forth, in a threefold state of the soul. 1 Endued with grace, 2 ensnared in sin, 3 troubled in conscience. With a concluding meditation on the fourth verse of the ninth chapter of Saint John. / By Edmund Gregory, sometimes Bachelour of Arts in Trin. Coll. Oxon.
author: Gregory, Edmund, b. 1615 or 16.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for Humphrey Moseley, and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the Prince's Arms in Pauls Church-yard,
